sn22.31:1.2: “Mendicants, I will teach you misery and the root of misery.
sn22.31:1.5: Form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are misery.
sn22.31:1.7: And what is the root of misery?
sn22.31:1.8: It’s the craving that leads to future lives, mixed up with relishing and greed, taking pleasure in various different realms. That is,
sn22.31:1.9: craving for sensual pleasures, craving to continue existence, and craving to end existence.
sn22.31:1.10: This is called the root of misery.”
